sentence.Network_en: Kozelek expresses his sense of desolation absolutely without self-pity.
sentence.Network_cn: 科泽莱克不带一丝顾影自怜地表达了自己的凄凉悲怆之感。

sentence.Network_en: We looked out upon a scene of desolation and ruin.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们放眼望去，眼前是一片荒凉的废墟。

list.abs: [desolate sands] 荒漠的滩涂把荒滩变为绿地 ◎ 荒唐 huāngtáng (1) [absurd;fantastic]∶广大而不着边际。引申为夸大不实或荒谬无理荒唐透顶 (2) [.
anda flame burneth : the land is as the garden of Eden before and behind them a desolate wilderness and nothing shall escape them .未到以前，地如伊甸园，过去以后，成了荒凉的旷野，没有一样能躲避它们的。
Heavy rain will wash away the soil from desolate hills ., 大雨将把泥土从荒凉的山丘上冲走.
Dust accumulated on the insulated simulator in the desolate lab ., 灰尘在孤独的实验室在被隔离的模拟器上堆积.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin desolatio(n-), from Latin desolare 'to abandon' (see desolate)

entry.def: Desolation is a feeling of great unhappiness and hopelessness.

example.ex: Kozelek expresses his sense of desolation absolutely without self-pity.
example.tran: 科泽莱克不带一丝顾影自怜地表达了自己的凄凉悲怆之感。

entry.tran: 荒凉;荒芜;荒废;满目疮痍
entry.def: If you refer to desolation in a place, you mean that it is empty and frightening, for example because it has been destroyed by a violent force or army.

example.ex: We looked out upon a scene of desolation and ruin...
example.tran: 我们放眼望去，眼前是一片荒凉的废墟。

example.ex: She says the army left desolation and death through the whole of northern Morazan.
example.tran: 她说军队在整个莫拉桑省北部留下了满目疮痍和遍野横尸。

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being decayed or destroyed
3. sadness resulting from being forsaken or abandoned
4. an event that results in total destruction

auth_sentence.content: England, whose desolation is thus sought and compassed.
auth_sentence.res_content: England, whose desolation is thus sought and compassed.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: England, whose desolation is thus sought and compassed.

auth_sentence.content: The general desolation of the place by the Danes.
auth_sentence.res_content: The general desolation of the place by the Danes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The general desolation of the place by the Danes.

auth_sentence.content: Even the son of God can experience utter desolation.
auth_sentence.res_content: Even the son of God can experience utter desolation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even the son of God can experience utter desolation.

stems_affixes.word_buile: de加强+sol单独+ate表形容词→非常单独→荒凉的
sol单独+e→adj.单独的,唯一的 n.脚垫,鞋底

stems_affixes.value_cn: [好]孤独的;偏僻的;单一的,唯一的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sol单独+itary→adj.[好]孤独的;偏僻的;单一的,唯一的
sol单独+o音乐术语→n.独奏 adj.&adv.单独的[地];独唱的[地]
desolate[adj.荒凉的;孤独的 v.使荒芜]+ion表名词→n.荒凉,凄凉
i=in+s=sol单独+land陆地→在[海洋]中间的单独陆地→岛,岛屿
sol单独+e→adj.单独的,唯一的 n.脚垫,鞋底
sol单独+itude状态→单独的状态→孤独
sol单独+o音乐术语→n.独奏 adj.&adv.单独的[地];独唱的[地]
para旁边+sol太阳→太阳旁边→不晒太阳→遮阳伞
solar太阳的+ium地方→n.日光浴室,日晷
de加强+sol单独+ate表形容词→非常单独→荒凉的
in进入+sol太阳+ate使……→进入太阳之中
solar[adj.太阳的,日光的]+ize表动词→v.[摄]使过度曝光,晒 v.曝光

sentences.en: He found the old house in complete desolation.
sentences.cn: 他发现那间旧房子十分荒凉。
